edge: Exchange for obtaining the Tesseract, the representative of an extraterrestrial race known as the Chitauri promises to provide Loki with an army to conquer Earth.
Loki steals the Tesseract and uses his scepter to enslave Selvig and other agents, including Clint Barton, to aid him.
Director of the covert agency S.H.I.E.L.D., Nick Fury arrives at a remote research facility where physicist Dr. Erik Selvig is leading a team studying the Tesseract.
Leading a team studying the Tesseract, Dr. Erik Selvig is enslaved by Loki using his scepter.
Agent Clint Barton is enslaved by Loki using his scepter.
Steve Rogers has a confrontation with Loki in Stuttgart after he steals iridium needed to stabilize the Tesseract.
Agent Phil Coulson visits Tony Stark so he can check Selvig's research, leading to a confrontation with Loki.
Agent Natasha Romanoff travels to Kolkata to recruit Dr. Bruce Banner so he can trace the Tesseract through its gamma radiation emissions.
Thor arrives and frees Loki, hoping to convince him to abandon his plan and return to Asgard. Stark and Rogers intervene, and Loki is imprisoned in S.H.I.E.L.D.'s flying base, the Helicarrier.
The Helicarrier is S.H.I.E.L.D.'s flying base where Loki is imprisoned.
Stark to abandon his plan and return to Asgard
Intervene
Imprisoned
Disagree on how to approach Loki and become argumentative once they realize S.H.I.E.L.D. plans to use the Tesseract to create weapons of mass destruction to use against extraterrestrial threats.
Attack
Transforms into the Hulk
Restart damaged engine while Thor attempts to stop the Hulk's rampage.
Subdues
During the argument, Loki's agents attack the Helicarrier, and in the chaos Banner transforms into the Hulk.

node_2: motivates the avengers to work together as a team
edge: Uses Coulson's subsequent death
Brings his Chitauri fleet
Protects New York from the Chitauri
Capacitates while Romanoff learns from Selvig, now freed from Loki's mind control, that Loki's scepter can shut down the generator.
Intercepts and flies it through the wormhole toward the Chitauri fleet.
The missile destroys the Chitauri mothership and disables their forces on Earth, implying that the Chitauri fleet was attempting to invade or attack Earth.
Stark becomes unconscious, and his suit loses power, leaving him freefalling towards Earth.
note: This implies that Stark was in a location close to Earth when he became unconscious and lost power.

edge: The Avengers manage to catch and resuscitate him.
note: This indicates that the Avengers were present in the vicinity of Stark's location when he became unconscious.

edge: Romanoff uses Loki's scepter to close the wormhole.
note: This suggests that Romanoff was in possession of Loki's scepter at the time and used it to carry out a specific action.

edge: Thor transports an imprisoned Loki and the Tesseract to Asgard.
note: This implies that Thor had Loki in his custody and transported him along with the Tesseract to Asgard.

edge: In Asgard, Loki will face Asgardian justice.
note: This indicates that Loki's actions in Earth had consequences for him and he would be held accountable in Asgard.

edge: The Other confers with his master[d] about the failed attack on Earth.
note: This implies that The Other was involved in the Chitauri invasion of Earth and sought guidance from a higher authority.
